result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Wertjes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office today.

*Huber priviliges for employment or any counseling the defendant may be involved in 
*Can be transferred to Juneau County, if approved
*60 days to start sentence
*Go to jail today for a start date
Concurrent with: Concurrent with other sentences

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF156, 15CF381, 17CF130 and 15CM172.

11:21 a.m.  Atty Molepske calls the case and states the appearances.  

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification but had provided victim impact statement(s) to the Court.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Ruby makes statements that Atty Renc was the attorney on 15CF381 and defendant is in approval of Atty Ruby completing the sentencing on these cases today.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF156:
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest
Count 5 - No contest 

15CF381:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest 

17CF130:
Count 1 - No contest 

15CM172:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - Dismissed
Count 3 - Dismissed
Count 4 - Dismissed 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court clarifies that victim had been given notification but does not appear in Court today.
Court questions the length of time for the Deferred Entry of Judgment being requested in the amount of 36 months; Atty Molepske makes statements on the record.
Atty Ruby makes his statements on the record regarding this issue.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF156, guilty on Count 3 of 15CF381 & Counts 1 & 2 are DRI and guilty on Count 1 of 17CF130 and guilty on Counts 3-5 on 15CM172.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Ruby makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF156:
Count 1 - 
Deferred Entry of Judgment for 36 months
Defendant to comply with all conditions of the Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement 
If defendant complies with all of the conditions of this agreement, the strangulation charge pending against the defendant will be amended to a Misdemeanor Battery and the 
defendant will serve 6 months in jail concurrent with any other jail sentence imposed at the time of sentencing.

Count 2 - 
Withheld sentence
Placed on Probation for 3 years -
Conditions of Probation:
Probation to commence today
Pay restitution in the amount of $12,611.49 - Parties stiuplate that a check in the amount of $6,306 had been received for the restitution; the remaining balance is to be paid within 12 months of 
the completion of the defendant's jail sentence on his other counts.  Restitution summary to be filed.
Pay costs
DNA SURCHARGE NOT REQUESTED 
*No contact with D.H.
*Write a letter of apology to the victim within the next 30 days and provide to agent for approval
*Attend and complete a Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
*Participate in any counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.

Count 3 -  DRI

Count 4 -
6 month jail sentence - huber priviliges for employment or any counseling the defendant may be involved in
60 days to start sentence
Go to jail today for start date
Jail to be served in Juneau County, if approved
104 days of incarceration credit
Pay costs
Pay domestic abuse surcharge
Set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office today.
Provide DNA sample
DNA SURCHARGE NOT REQUESTED 

Count 5 - 
6 month jail sentence - consecutive with huber priviliges for employment or any counseling the defendant may be involved in
Go to jail today for start date
60 days to start sentence
Can be transsferred to Juneau County, if approved 
Pay costs
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office
DNA SURCHARGE NOT REQUESTED 

15CF381:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 - 
Sentence to 30 days of jail - concurrent with huber priviliges for employment or any counseling the defendant may be involved in
2 days jail credit
Can be transferred to Juneau County, if approved 
60 days to start sentence
Go to jail today for start date
Pay $300 fine plus costs
DNA SURCHARGE NOT REQUESTED 
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office today.

17CF130:
Count 1 - 
Deferred Entry of Judgment for 36 months
Defendant to comply with all conditions of the Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement 
If the defendant complies with all of the conditions of this agreement, the charges pending against the defendant will be dismissed with prejudice 

20 days to appeal cases

**Sentencing Clerk had discussions with fellow Clerk's in the office with regards to how the Information (had been changed so that both cases were included on one Information for the purpose of a Jury Trial) had been filed for cases 15CF156 and 15CM172 - 15CF156 had Count 1 and 15CM172 had Count's 2-5 which does not match the way the case had been initially filed, so further discussions with the Br 3 sentencing Judge it was determined that the easiest way to resolve this issue (clerk was not able to amend the Count's in 15CM172) was to dismiss Count's 1-4 in 15CM172 outright and then add Count's 2-5 to 15CF156.  Clerk updated the cases as per the discussion with Br 3 Judge.
Status conference on December 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby and Anne Renc. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF156, 15CM172 (Atty Ruby), 15CF381 (Atty Renc)
3:27 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Atty Constable states the appearances. 
Victim is present in Court. 

Atty Constable makes statements re: objection to an adjournment by both defense counsels. 
Atty Ruby addresses the Court re: the request for adjournment.  Defendant has entered treatment. 
Court questions Atty Ruby. 
Atty Renc addresses the Court re: joining in the request for adjournment. 
Atty Constable makes arguments to the Court against adjournment. 
Atty Ruby makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Victim makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Constable. 
Atty Constable states she is revoking the plea offer for the reasons stated on the record and requesting a jury trial on the matters. 
Atty Ruby makes statements to the Court.  Was not given advance notice of the withdrawn offer.

Court notes the oldest file will be heard first.  Reviews the files.  Notes the CF cases have the same offense date.  Questions if the matters should be heard together. 
Atty Constable indicates the CF matters would be appropriate to try together.  State will file a motion for joinder. 

BY THE COURT:  
15CF156 & 15CM172 to be set for jury trial. 
15CF381 is to be set for a status conference on that date.

Atty Ruby questions the court re: scheduling a final pre-trial or status conference.  Asks for a status conference a couple of weeks ahead of time.  Make that the date that there will be no more plea negotiations. 

Court advises Atty Constable to be sure the DA speaks with the victim re: any resolutions. 
Atty Constable states she has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  
  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
letter from Atty Cole D Ruby dated 08/10/16 in re:  request to continue the plea/sentencing set for 08/30/16 - original filed in 15CF156
Telephone scheduling conference on August 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
original filed in 15CF156
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
original filed in 15CF156
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference at 02-29-2016 08:45 am
filed by DA EC
Pre-trial conference at 01-11-2016 10:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

3:14 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 12-14-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes appeared by video.  Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 11-30-2015 01:30 pm
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 11-30-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

9:54 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant spoke with public defender's office, assumes that he qualifies.

Court reviews the file.  Defendant failed to appear in Court October 12th.
Court questions Defendant why he failed to appear.

Address is verified.
Defendant lives with his mother, is not employed at this time.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant did get a copy of the complaint, got paperwork but was confusing.

Court will continue this for an initial appearance for an attorney to represent Defendant.

State does not object to the bond being reinstated.

Defendant is serving a sentence on a primary case, strangulation, have to serve 300 days.

BY THE COURT:
Court will continue the bond with same conditions.

Public defender will appoint someone and case will be adjourned.




  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler J. Wertjes
Current: 603 S Main Street, Neceeda, WI 54646   (Effective: 11-20-2015)
Prior: 603 S Main St 30, Neceeda, WI 54646
cc: DA w/ minutes 10/21/15
sent to Judge for signature 10/13/15 ks

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:42 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins requests a criminal warrant.  No objection to a $500 cash alternative. 

BY THE COURT:  So ordered.

ADA  Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:24 PM Court calls case.

ADA  Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bailjumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond of $200  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: October 12, 2015    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
Follow all conditions of bond as previously ordered in 15CF-156 and 15CM-172.
